page.title: 03ST.Martin's Church_Stapleton
page.content: There has been a church here for 1,000 years.It is in the diocese of Leicester.Until recently,burials took place at Barwell,the mother church.The service of Holy Communion is on Sunday at 9.30a.m;approximate attendance is 18. Every 2nd Sunday of the month there is a family service at 11a.m; approximate attendance is 25.From June 1984-June 1985 there have been 4 baptisms,5 banns,2 marriages, 2 confirmations and 4 burials.Sunday School attendance is approximately 18. There are 2 church wardens. {ARCHITECTURE}:There is a small gargoyle outside,above the east window, and 2 ancient carved slabs,found during repairs in 1936,are now behind the altar.An interesting feature is the wooden gallery.The church has been recently renovated.
